author.name: Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

entry.title: More services sectors available
entry.content:
The Portal now includes the following sectors:

  • Education
  • Finance
  • Medical and Dental
  • Hospital
  • Tourism
  • Computing.

The API has been updated accordingly. See http://ausftas.github.io/apidocs/. We continue to encourage feedback and questions on the API service here. More sectors will be added to the Portal soon.
entry.summary:
The Portal now includes the following sectors:

  • Education
  • Finance
  • Medical and Dental
  • Hospital

entry.title: Services information now available
entry.content:
FTAs can improve market access across all areas of trade including services. The Portal now includes services information from the following sectors:

  • Accounting, bookkeeping and auditing
  • Taxation
  • Architectural
  • Legal services - Foreign law
  • Legal services - Host country law
  • Integrated Engineering

A new version of the API is also available reflecting these changes. See http://ausftas.github.io/apidocs/ for more details. We continue to encourage feedback and questions on the API service here.

entry.title: Two new agreements available
entry.content:
Two additional agreements were added to the site on 27 June 2017:

  • Australia-Chile Free Trade Agreement (AClFTA)
  • Australia-United States Free Trade Agreement (AUSFTA)

The API has been updated accordingly. See http://ausftas.github.io/apidocs/. We continue to encourage feedback and questions on the API service here.
entry.summary:
Two additional agreements were added to the site on 27 June 2017:

  • Australia-Chile Free Trade Agreement (AClFTA)
  • Aus

entry.title: Three new agreements now available
entry.content:
Three additional agreements were added to the site on 12 April 2017:

  • ASEAN-Australia-New Zealand Free Trade Agreement (AANZFTA)
  • Singapore-Australia Free Trade Agreement (SAFTA)
  • Thailand-Australia Free Trade Agreement (TAFTA)

The API has been updated accordingly. Please note that v1 API elements which were previously deprecated have been completely removed in this version, see http://ausftas.github.io/apidocs/. We continue to encourage feedback and questions on the API service here.

  • ASEAN-Australia-New Zealand Free Trade Agreement (AANZF

entry.title: Malaysia and New Zealand Free Trade Agreements now available
entry.content:
As at 30 November 2016, in addition to the existing agreements with China, Japan and Korea, the FTA Portal now includes two additional bilateral free trade agreements:

  • Malaysia-Australia Free Trade Agreement (MAFTA)
  • Australia-New Zealand Closer Economic Relations Trade Agreement (ANZCERTA)

The API has been updated accordingly. We continue to encourage feedback and questions on the API service here.
entry.summary: As at 30 November 2016, in addition to the existing agreements with China, Japan and Korea, the FTA Portal now includes two additional bi

entry.title: Welcome
entry.content:
Welcome to the Free Trade Agreement Portal Developer Resources.

The FTA Portal is an Australian Government Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) initiative. The Portal enables users to explore how goods traders can benefit from Australia’s Free Trade Agreements with China, Japan and South Korea. A beta version of the FTA Portal Application Programming Interface (API) is available to provide developers easy access to preferential tariff and rules of origin information. The FTA Portal API will remain as a beta service during the expansion of the Portal to cover all of Australia’s existing FTAs. It will be reviewed in the second half of 2017.

All developer resources, including updates associated with the FTA Portal API, will be posted here.
entry.summary: Welcome to the Free Trade Agreement Portal Developer Resources
